skill.name: Global Error Handling
skill.description: Implement robust error handling with user-friendly messages, specific exception types, fail-fast validation, centralized error boundaries, graceful degradation, and proper resource cleanup. Use this skill when writing try-catch blocks, raising exceptions, handling API errors, validating input, implementing error boundaries, managing external service failures, or ensuring resource cleanup. Apply when working with error handling code in any language, exception classes, error middleware, API error responses, retry logic, or any code that needs to handle failures gracefully while maintaining system stability and providing clear feedback to users.

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and guidelines. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access capabilities. The skill provides error handling best practices for Claude Code to follow when writing code.

content.value_statement: This skill helps developers write resilient code with proper exception handling, user-friendly error messages, and graceful failure management. It guides Claude Code to create error boundaries, implement retry logic, and ensure proper resource cleanup in any language.
actual_capabilities: Writes try-catch blocks with proper exception types
Creates custom exception classes with meaningful messages
Implements error boundaries and centralized error handling
Adds fail-fast validation for user input
Manages resource cleanup with finally blocks
Implements retry logic for transient failures
limitations: Does not execute code or run error handling tests
Does not integrate with error monitoring services directly
Does not modify existing error handling in user projects without explicit request

use_cases.title: Build Resilient Applications
use_cases.description: Add comprehensive error handling to new or existing codebases across Python, JavaScript, Java, and other languages.

use_cases.title: Handle Service Failures
use_cases.description: Implement retry logic and graceful degradation for external API calls and microservice integrations.

use_cases.title: Create User-Friendly Errors
use_cases.description: Design error messages and UI states that help users understand and recover from failures.

prompt_templates.title: Basic exception handling
prompt_templates.scenario: Add error handling to a function
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a function that safely handles errors with try-catch blocks, custom exceptions, and proper resource cleanup using finally blocks.

prompt_templates.title: API error management
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement retry logic with exponential backoff and circuit breaker pattern for external API calls.

prompt_templates.title: Input validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create input validation that fails fast with specific error messages before processing.

prompt_templates.title: Error boundaries
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a React error boundary component that catches JavaScript errors and displays fallback UI.

output_examples.input: Add error handling to a file reading function
output: Catch file not found errors with specific messages
Always close file handles in finally block
Log errors with context for debugging

best_practices: Use specific exception types instead of catching generic Exception
Provide actionable error messages that help users understand what went wrong
Clean up resources in finally blocks or use context managers
anti_patterns: Catching bare except: clauses that hide all errors
Swallowing exceptions without logging or re-raising
Writing error messages that blame users without helpful guidance

faq.question: What programming languages does this skill support?
faq.answer: This skill provides guidance for error handling in any language including Python, JavaScript, Java, Go, and other common programming languages.

faq.question: Does this skill execute code or make changes to my project?
faq.answer: No, this skill provides guidance to Claude Code on how to write error handling code. All code generation happens only when you explicitly request it.

faq.question: Can I use this skill with React error boundaries?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill includes guidance for implementing React error boundaries that catch JavaScript errors and display fallback UI components.

faq.question: Does this skill integrate with error monitoring tools like Sentry?
faq.answer: The skill can guide you to write code that integrates with monitoring services, but you need to configure and install those integrations separately.

faq.question: What is fail-fast validation?
faq.answer: Fail-fast validation checks all inputs upfront and reports all errors immediately, rather than partial failures during processing.

faq.question: How is this different from standard try-catch patterns?
faq.answer: This skill extends basic error handling with specific exception types, centralized error boundaries, retry strategies, and graceful degradation patterns.
